required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: KinetiGait- Analysis of Depth Camera to Assist Gait Analysis for Unilateral Transtibial/Transfemoral Amputees
clinical_study.official_title: Operational Analysis of Depth Camera to Assist Gait Analysis in Outpatient Rehabilitation for Unilateral Transtibial and Transfemoral Amputees

lead_sponsor.agency: Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine

clinical_study.source: Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This is a feasibility study about implementing and using the KinetiGait gait analysis system in clinical practice to enhance the rehabilitation of service members with lower limb disfunction. There will be questionnaires completed by participants and surveys completed by both participant and provider.

detailed_description.textblock: We propose a feasibility study about implementing and using the KinetiGait gait analysis system in clinical practice to enhance the rehabilitation of service members with lower limb dysfunction. Up to 100 subjects will be consented, with the expectation that 80% (e.g., n=80) will complete the study with a complete dataset. Baseline sessions will consist of 7 minutes of walking at a self-selected speed between 0.7 and 1.3 m/s, after which participants will take the PLUS-M 12 Item Short Form and PROMIS-29 questionnaires, as well as a short survey. Participants will complete the questionnaires again at 1 month and 3 month. Providers who observed/operated the KinetiGait system will also take a short survey on ease of use and satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Prosthetic Limb Users Survey of Mobility (PLUS-M)
primary_outcome.description: 12-item short form to assess functional status, quality of life and perceived mobility.
Measures self-reported capability rather than actual performance of physical capabilities.

secondary_outcome.description: Survey for providers indicating age, level of clinical training, experience with gait analysis and views on integrating technology into the clinical environment.

intervention.description: This device is an Intel RGB depth camera that relays video to gait analysis software. The images will be taken from amputees walking at a self-selected pace on a treadmill.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include individuals who are DEERS-eligible between the ages of 18 and 65 and in K2-K4 Medical Functional Classification levels. The providers must be MHS providers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral transfemoral or transtibial amputee
- Fitted by a prosthetist at a Military Treatment Facility
- K2-K4 Medicare Functional Classification Levels
- DEERS-eligible.
- For providers: MHS provider
Exclusion Criteria:
- K0-K1 Medicare Functional Classification Levels
- Physically unstable or requires an ambulatory device
- Pregnant women

clinical_study.keyword: depth camera, gait analysis, LE loss, SMs and Veterans
